185673643.review:
Without a doubt, Heroes & Generals stands as one of the best games I’ve ever played. My story with it began on May 8, 2016. That day, I was feeling utterly bored—no game could satisfy me anymore. I felt like an orphan, wandering aimlessly in search of an online war game to fill the void. That’s when I decided to search “best online war games,” and two titles caught my attention: War Thunder and Heroes & Generals.

At first glance, Heroes & Generals didn’t appeal to me visually, but I decided to give it a chance. That night, I set War Thunder to download and went to bed, eager to try it in the morning. The next day, I woke up excited, played some War Thunder (which would later become my second most-played game), and started downloading Heroes & Generals. Finally, at the end of the day, I was ready to give it a try.

My first impression wasn’t great: the movement felt clunky, lag due to high ping was constant, and the game didn’t run well on my PC. But for some reason, I kept going. The slow, grindy progression system was frustrating, but it hooked me. I couldn’t stop thinking about unlocking better weapons and tanks to fully explore the game’s potential.

As time passed and the game evolved through updates, I realized that Heroes & Generals was truly one of a kind. It stood out as the spiritual successor to Battlefield 1942, offering an experience unmatched in the online FPS market. My bond with the game grew stronger—I found myself eagerly anticipating updates and dreaming about what Reto-Moto could add to improve it. I even sent in suggestions: airfields for aircraft spawns, new classes, and additional tools. To this day, I don’t know if those ideas were ever read, let alone considered.

Despite its flaws, Heroes & Generals managed to carve out a special place in my heart. It wasn’t perfect, but its essence made it exceptional. Unfortunately, over time, it became clear that the developers were losing interest in the game. Whether due to lack of resources or personal reasons, I can’t say. What I do know is that Heroes & Generals could have been the BEST World War II FPS, had it received the attention it deserved. Starting as a browser game, it gradually grew into something the community cherished.

Looking back, Heroes & Generals defined my teenage years and accompanied me into adulthood. It taught me that what truly makes a game great isn’t just its graphics, gameplay, or story—it’s the positive, lasting impact it leaves on someone’s life. For me, Heroes & Generals was that game, one I’ll never forget.

To Heroes & Generals, my deepest thanks.

184997051.review:
Only played this game a little bit. I miss it a lot. One of my all time favorite games and had so many fun memories on it right up until the end.  One thing I really enjoyed was the final year. The player base was so small you that almost everyone was dedicated and knew what to do in a game. Would constantly see familiar faces and it was a great community. 

One of my favorite memories was on Airfield as america attacking the D line I think(The one where you cross the bridge). Fighting Germany. The whole game we could not cross the bridge to get the next objective (and I was still somewhat new). We all keep rushing and dying. Until I had an idea me and one other person waited at spawn with two jeeps and carried almost our entire team on 2 jeeps. I think I had 7-8 people on my jeep. We somehow made it across the bridge and broke the fence into the point and bum rushed it catching the enemy off guard and were able to win in the last few minutes. 

I had so many good memories from this game and there is still nothing like it. I hope some developer sees this and brings the game that we know and love back for us to play.

184749385.review:
英雄与将军是我二战题材多人FPS游戏的入坑之作（朋友邀请+免费）。虽然游戏停服，转战战地已有一年多了，但这款游戏仍让我记忆犹新。
它仅凭几个G的体量，在玩法上能做到不输几十个G的战地V，而且其中的突击模式真正带给了我攻城掠地、向前推进的感觉，这是我玩战地占点模式和攻防模式所体验不到的。
甚是想念，耿耿于怀：我们因不可抗的原因失去了一款值得游玩的好游戏，而投入到它之中那充满着酸甜苦辣的数十数百个小时的游玩经历也随之沉淀于记忆的深处——关服删除了英雄与将军的世界！（真的很久）
Man! What can I say? H&G out！

184551814.review: It's been a while since I last played this game and I wish I had played it more, but I can say with absolute confidence that this is one of the best FPS games I've played, I only have good memories of it. Its wide and open maps, its weapons, its vehicules and gamemodes all made for a fun experience, and an absolute banger of a game when played with friends. To think that this game was free is absolutely baffling and I genuinely hope for its return and success as it is the most satisfying World War II themed game that I've played.
